function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Rising prevalence and severity of pollinosis","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Impact of climate change and air pollution on pollinosis exposure","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Excess algal growth in urban bodies of water","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Risks associated with rodent habitat near ponds due to undisturbed vegetation","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Health risks associated with water toxins and algal blooms","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Algal blooms may produce phytotoxins and hepatotoxins, leading to water contamination and health risks for humans and animals.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Neurotoxins produced by algal blooms can affect the nervous system of exposed organisms, leading to severe health effects and potential fatality.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Algal blooms in urban ponds may pose less of a threat to humans, but still require monitoring and management to prevent any potential risks.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increased overgrowth of aquatic vegetation leading to low dissolved oxygen levels and stagnant water areas","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Excessive growth of algae and cyanobacteria in urban ponds","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Poorly designed landscape details contributing to production of troublesome numbers of mosquitoes","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of natural predators in constructed bodies of water leading to
